availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City & County of New York } Sct

I, Isaac Spencer Smith, Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, duly appointed & commissioned by the Governor thereof, for the State of New York and authorized to take the acknowledgement of Deeds and other writings, do solemnly swear, that I will well and truly ^to^ execute and perform all the duties of the said office.

Given under my hand and official seal this 30th day of November, 1865
Ths Clarke
A justice of the Supreme Court of the State of New York.

figure.ab:
I. SPENCER SMITH
COMMISSIONER
FOR
Kentucky
IN
NEW YORK.

body.p:
Official Signature
I Spencer Smith
Commr for Kentucky
In N. Y. Cy.
Oath of Office as Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky
